summary: A new Castle high in the mountains south of Falkreath with a mid ranged length high difficulty quest to recieve a new fully voiced follower, in the style of heavy armor/sword and board combat!
descriptionHtml:
This is my first successful mod that I will be uploading. The mod adds a castle which can become a player owned estate, containing plenty of weapon/shield racks, standing weapon racks, all the facilities you would need to perform alchemy/enchanting, 12 total mannequins, a throne room, a trophy room, several locations to plant alchemy ingredients, all spread out across six separate rooms. The layout of the castle is simple 4 on top of 2 rooms, with two floors total. Throne room, trophy room, armory, and library/guest banquet hall on the first floor, with the second floor containing mead hall, children's room, and master bedroom.

The children's room is still currently under development to allow your actual children adopted through hearthfire to live with you. This functionality is planned for a future patch.

There is a courtyard currently, but it is currently next-to-empty. I have plans for a future quest line involving the courtyard in the near future.

The mod also adds a new quest named Shadows of the Moon, where you help a poor elf(breton, not really an elf) to slay a necromancer that has been haunting her family for generations. The quest will start as soon as you enter a town or village, where the courier will come up and hand you a letter. A word of caution, this quest shouldn't be attempted in the first ten levels unless you are particularly skilled.

At the end of the quest, you will be officially given Frostholme Hall as your personal estate, and will unlock the services of a new fully voiced follower Willow Rosenwood, modeled after my wife's character. Willow is a heavy armor, sword and board fighter class combatant. She currently has a partial marriage quest option, with the only housing option after marriage being Frostholme Hall itself. I plan to leave it this way to show a more sentimental attachment to her family's estate.

This mod has been tested on at least three occasions with minor bugfixes each time, so it is not perfect, there may be issues here and there for other users. I am unaware of any incompatibilities at this current moment, so if anything is encountered please report it so I can work on fixing it.

This mod DOES require all official DLC.

Future releases plan to include:
1. Fully functional adopted children access
2. Larger, more useful courtyard
3. Guards for the estate
4. Additional dungeons with related questlines
5. Two additional fully voiced followers modeled after Willow's brothers, Manus Locus, the mage, and Virtus Sectus the ranger
6. Quest driven expansion to the estate
7. Linked to expansion, options to expand into a full fledged village
8. Potential wars with Falkreath for territory
9. A true mage's tower
10. Potentially new guild options
author: Aerizanthar
